metadata.title: USN-6488-2 -- strongSwan vulnerability
metadata.description: USN-6488-1 fixed a vulnerability in strongSwan. This update provides the corresponding updates for Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.  Original advisory details:   Florian Picca discovered that strongSwan incorrectly handled certain DH  public values. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause strongSwan  to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary  code.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6488-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  strongswan-nm - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 strongswan-scepclient - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 libcharon-standard-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 strongswan-tnc-pdp - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 strongswan-charon - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 libstrongswan - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 strongswan-tnc-client - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 strongswan-tnc-server - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 charon-systemd - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 strongswan - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 strongswan-tnc-ifmap - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 strongswan-swanctl - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 strongswan-tnc-base - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 charon-cmd - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 strongswan-pki - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 strongswan-starter - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 strongswan-libcharon - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.9+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
